column4: guys help, I thikn I am crazy. 'sudo apt-get install biblatex' says: 'biblatex is already the newest version.' but when I write biblatex I get: 'biblatex: command not found'. What am I doing wrong?
dpkg -L biblatex|grep "/usr/bin/"
wow thanks, was that missing in the install script or soemthing?
whats the output of that command? it actually changes nothing
from what i read, that is only a library, nothing you can run directly
ah yea you are right, (I might be goign crazy), no output
but where is the executable with that name hiding then?
it has no binary, i don't know how to use it, i guess you have to include it into your tex-projects
check http://www.hep.man.ac.uk/u/jenny/jcwdocs/latex/bibtexbasics.html
there shuold be a standalone binary which you run. At least that's how it works on my mac. And bibtex is not the same as biblatex
oh sry
oh that's no problem, perhaps you are good with apt though and can help me find the executable?
only thing with related is: biblatex-dw - Biblatex styles for humanities
lacks a binary too.
hm, I guess I should try some biblatex page on the intertubes then...
http://www.charlietanksley.net/pdf/latex-footnote-citations.pdf   just an addon to be referenced in your latex-files
I am sorry, I didn't wuite follow, are you still thinking there is no executable?
yes, without deeper research. for me that is just a library you can use in your latex-files

I am sorry you do not trust me. I have used the program on my Mac, it is both a latex package and a standalone program. It's a bibliography generator. The standalone program generates files with the bibliographeis which the package then includes in the document. At least that is how it works on my other computer... :)
mac == os x? this is linux
yea I run it on os x, but it hsould work the same on Ubuntu linux
there might be a package doing what you want, but none of those two in the apt-repos will do
yea, thanks for your help anyway
